### Help

If experiencing issues with the NSA event IDs, follow these steps to address the error:
1. Find the nsaRecommendedEvents parameter.
2. Click edit under the parameter.
3. Click on the parameter name and click on the pencil icon.
4. Click 'mark as trusted'.
5. Click save.

This process is required when utilizing external sources of information outside of Azure. Once the source is trusted, the data can be used in the workbook.

content.json:
#### Feedback

Looking to provide feedback? Use [this form here](https://forms.microsoft.com/r/dQvGMjpD2H).

[Data Collection Rules (DCRs)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-rule-overview) define the data collection process in Azure Monitor. DCRs specify what data should be collected, how to transform that data, and where to send that data. Some DCRs will be created and managed by Azure Monitor to collect a specific set of data to enable insights and visualizations. You may also create your own DCRs to define the set of data required for other scenarios.

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Identify_what_to_collect-blue) 
- You first want to identify what type of data sources you wish to collect.

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Identify_where_to_store_logs-blue) 
- Identify the target workspace to store the data based on region, compliance regulations, access. (Only if this applies)

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Decide_to_filter_or_transform_the_data-blue) 
- Decide if you wish to transform the data prior to storing the data
	- It's recommended to parse and filter the data prior to ingestion, but you can leverage KQL to transform/filter the data prior to storage. 

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Begin_onboarding_and_complete_dependencies-blue) 
- **Complete pre-requisites and onboard devices**
	- You will then want to complete any initial pre-requisites and onboarding to ensure you have the data sources ready to send logs to the target workspace.

## Onboard Azure Resources
![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Recommended-darkgreen) 
- Onboard Azure Resources automatically by including them as data sources when [configuring a Data Collection Rule](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-rule-overview#create-a-data-collection-rule) in the portal.

![Alternative](https://shields.io/badge/-Alternative-purple)
- Workloads also could also be onboarded to Sentinel via [Defender for Cloud](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/auto-deploy-azure-monitoring-agent), or [Azure Policy](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/azure-monitor-agent-manage?tabs=azure-portal#use-azure-policy) using [Extensions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/azure-monitor-agent-manage?tabs=ARMAgentPowerShell%2CPowerShellWindows%2CPowerShellWindowsArc%2CCLIWindows%2CCLIWindowsArc) to deploy the AMA Agent.

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Manual-orange)
- Install manually with installer script provided during configuration of Data Colleciton Rule or downloading the Arc agent installer manually.
- [Download the client installer (preview)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2192409) and follow the [guidance](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2191897) here.

## Cloud and On-premises devices
devices residing in other cloud environments (ie: AWS, Google) or on-premises will require installing an [agent](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2191897).

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Recommended-darkgreen) 
- Its highly recommended to onboard devices via [Azure Arc](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-arc/servers/learn/quick-enable-hybrid-vm) (It's Free). Once onboarded, it will look similar to an Azure VM where you can now point your data collection rule to it, load extensions, run scripts, and additional basic management. 
	- [Connect hybrid machines to Azure Arc](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-arc/servers/onboard-portal)
	- Once you have onboarded the machines to Azure Arc, they will appear as a VM. You may configure data colleciton for these devices via an existing DCR or by creating a new one as shown in the Azure Data Sources tab.

![recommended](https://shields.io/badge/-Manual-orange) 
- Manual installation - Leverage the scripts provided for the associated agent to onboard manually. 
	- [Connect hybrid machines to Azure by using Powershell](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-arc/servers/onboard-powershell)

## Custom Logs and Transformation Rules

For general information, please see: </br>
- [Custom logs via API](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/logs-ingestion-api-overview) </br>
- [Custom logs via Agent](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/data-collection-text-log) </br>
- [Transfromation rules](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-transformations)

![Custom](https://shields.io/badge/-Custom-darkgreen) 
- Custom log ingestion via API endpoint will require a [data collection endpoint](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-endpoint-overview?tabs=portal).
- Once the endpoint is configured, data collection rules can be applied to the endpoint for ingestion.
- Calls made to the ingestion API will point at the URI of the DCE that was created.
	
![Transform](https://shields.io/badge/-Transform-orange) 

It is recommended to apply transformations to logs that require data to be dropped, modified, or transformed. These tables most commonly fall within that category: </br>
- SecurityEvent
- Syslog provided by multiple vendors or for parsing the message
- CommonSecurityLog provided by multiple vendors </br>

Transformations follow a simple KQL structure to apply the changes at ingest time. Examples structures can be found [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-transformations-structure).

content.json:
### Help and Guide

This tab is meant to disect the data collection stream that is configued within the DCR that was selected in the previous tab. This section breaks up the stream into data sources, data flow, transformation, and destination. </br>

This information should be used when reviewing DCRs granularly. 

#### Data Sources
This portion will list the type of stream (Windows, Syslog, Custom, etc.) The stream name will show which table the data will be sent to. The name of the source can be clicked on to review the properties from the DCR. A source will not be listed if the source is custom or a workspace transform.</br>

#### Data Flow
This portion will list the start of the stream, if there is a KQL transform and what it is, and the end location for the data. If there is a transformation rule in place to send the data elsewhere, this area will refect that. Ex. Custom-SecurityEvent -> Microsoft-SecurityEvent </br>

If looking to add or modify existing transform KQL for the DCR, go back to the third tab and use the 'modify DCR' section to modify and update the template. If looking to create a new table transformation, go back to the second tab and use the 'transform DCR' button to create a new one. </br>

#### Destination Workspace
This portion will highlight the streams that exist within the DCR and which workspace they are pointing to. In a multi-homing DCR, more than one workspace will be listed.
![DCR Name](https://shields.io/badge/{selectedRuleFormatted:$.name}-{selectedRuleFormatted:$.type}-blue?logo={selectedRuleIcon}&style=for-the-badge)

**Data Source types :**
{dataSourceTypes:$.*}

content.json:
### Help

A few options are offered:
- Linux
- Windows
- Table Transform
- Essentials

#### Linux
The Linux button will open two options for deploying DCRs. The two options are for Syslog or CEF. When one of the buttons is clicked, a DCR wizard will open for the log type. This DCR wizard is the same experience that be found in Azure Monitor.

#### Windows
The Windows button will expand collection options based on scenarios such as: </br>
- NSA Recommended Event IDs
- MITRE Tactic Alignment
- Recommended Event IDs
- File path via the existing wizard</br>

#### Transform
The Table Transformation button will open a builder to assist in building a table transform DCR. These DCRs will apply ingestion transformation to logs brought in (these rules do not apply to AMA data sources).

#### Custom Logs
This button will open the tables blade wizard for creating new custom logs via DCR. This will provide the ability to upload a file to generate the schema and create a transformation on the data at ingestion time.

#### Essentials
The Essentials button will expand options for UEBA, Analytic Rules, and Hunting. These three options will allow for DCRs that contains the essential event IDs for both features to operate to be deployed.

### Help

#### Data Collection Transformation

[Transformations in Azure Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/data-collection-transformations.md) allow you to filter or modify incoming data before it's stored in a Log Analytics workspace. They are implemented as a [Kusto Query Language (KQL)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/) statement in a [data collection rule (DCR)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-rule-overview). 

- [Data collection transformations in Azure Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-transformations)

#### Considerations
- During ingestion time transformation, you are limited to a smaller set of [functions/operators](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-transformations-structure) to filter/transform the data.
	- Since the transformation is applied to each record individually, it can't use any KQL operators that act on multiple records.
	- For example, summarize isn't supported since it summarizes multiple records. 

#### Data Collection Endpoints (DCE)
[Data Collection Endpoints](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-endpoint-overview?tabs=portal) are not required unless you:
- Have a need to provide connection for certain data sources of Azure Monitor. 
- Wish to use only use private links to communicate and send data and prevent ingesting through the public network access. [(Click for Example)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-endpoint-sample)

To create a table transform rule: </br>
1. Select the workspace that houses the tables that should be transformed.
2. Select a table that will be transformed.
3. Choose a DCR name that will be for the rule.
4. Review the schema for the selected table in order to see which columns already exist.
5. For transformation, enter a query in the TransformQuery box. Make sure that it is a single line.
6. Optional: Click on 'Open Workspace Editor' to open the workspace in order to write queries and verify that. Copy the query body and paste it into the TransformQuery box. Ensure that the table remains as 'source'.
7. Click on the 'Deploy Transform DCR' button to deploy the template.

content.json:
### Help

This section will allow users to choose different scenarios and categorizations in order to define which event IDs are ingested via DCR. In order to do so:
1. Click on a category for event IDs to be populated.
2. Select which category of events should be inested.
3. Manually enter any additional event IDs that are needed.
4. Review the event IDs to ensure anything of interest is configured for ingestion.
5. Provide a name for the DCR.
6. Click on the 'Deploy DCR' button.

### Help

The 3 tiers listed below for ingestion are in reference to the tiers available today via the Legacy Agent connector (MMA) and the Security Event via AMA connector.

For the exact events collected in each tier, please see: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/windows-security-event-id-reference#event-id-reference

### Help

These options have been pulled from a public NSA list of recommended events to monitor. Each event is categorized grouped based on classification. Selecting one of the options below will generate the xPath required to ingest the events. For any additional events of interest, either selet an ingestion tier above or manually enter event IDs below where provided.

### Help

The options below are align event IDs with different MITRE tactics. Selecting ingest for the different tactics will generate the xPath for collecting the relevant events. For any additional events outside of the tactics, either select an ingestion tier above or manually enter event IDs below where provided. </br>

For more information on MSTIC, please see https://www.microsoft.com/security/blog/microsoft-security-intelligence/

### Help

These events are recommended by MSFT as highlighted here: https://learn.microsoft.com/windows-server/identity/ad-ds/plan/appendix-l--events-to-monitor </br>

These events are categorized by criticality level. Selecting different levels will modify which events have xPath generated for them. If there are additional events needed outside of the list provided, select an ingestion tier above or manually enter event IDs below in the space provided.

parameters.name: IngestArray
nsaIds
parameters.query:
// First Parse the NSA JSON
print events=todynamic({nsaRecommendedEvents:parsejson})
| extend events = events['Recommended Events to Collect']
// First we pivot the data
| mv-apply events on (
    extend Category = tostring(bag_keys(events)[0])
| extend IdentityCheck = iff('{Identity}' == 'Ingest', Category in ("Account Usage", "Pass the Hash Detection", "Remote Desktop Logon Detection"), false),
            NetworkCheck = iff('{Network}' == 'Ingest', Category in ("Network Policy", "Windows Firewall"), false),
            SystemCheck = iff('{System}' == 'Ingest', Category in ("Application Whitelisting", "Application Crashes", "System or Service Failures", "Clearing Event Logs", "Software and Service Installation", "Kernel Driver Signing", "Windows Defender Activities", "DNS/Directory Services", "Certificate Service", "Boot Events", "System Integrity") , false),
            UserCheck = iff('{User}' == 'Ingest', Category in ("PowerShell Activities", "Mobile Device Activities") , false)
    | extend description = events[Category].description
    | extend events = events[Category].events
    | where IdentityCheck == true or IdentityCheck == true or NetworkCheck == true or UserCheck == true
)
| mv-apply events on (
    extend eventName = tostring(bag_keys(events)[0])
    | extend eventId = tostring(bag_keys(events[eventName])[0])
    | extend properties = events[eventName][eventId]
    | project-away events
)
| evaluate bag_unpack(properties)
| project eventId = split(replace_regex(eventId,@'\s',@''),','), eventName
| mvexpand eventId
| summarize by toint(eventId), eventName
| sort by eventId asc
| project packed = pack_all()

print ids=manualIds
| project ids = todynamic(strcat('[', replace_regex(ids,"\'",""),']'))
| mv-expand ids
| project ids = toint(ids)

parameters.name: parseExclude

let manualIds = "{NSAExclude}";
print ids=manualIds
| project ids = todynamic(strcat('[', replace_regex(ids,"\'",""),']'))
| mv-expand ids
| project ids = toint(ids)

parameters.name: merged
generatedJSON
parameters.query:
// Referenced merged array
let generated = () {
    print merged="{merged:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | top 100 by toint(merged) asc
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",merged,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]]")
    | summarize makeset(p)
};
generated

parameters.name: NSADCR2
parameters.query:
let Count = print merged="{merged:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | summarize count()
    | extend Counter = toint(count_);
let Check =
    Count
    | extend Check = iff(Counter <= 100, 'DCR not needed', 'DCR needed')
    | extend Math = Counter - 100
    | extend diff = iff(Math < 0 or Math > 100, 'New DCR will not work', array_split(todynamic("{merged:escapejson}"), 100)[1])
    | extend diff = todynamic(diff)
    | mv-expand diff
    | project toint(diff)
    | top 100 by diff asc
    | summarize Array = make_set(diff);
let Configure = (Array:dynamic) { 
print Array 
    | extend Array = todynamic(Array)
    | mv-expand Array
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",Array,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = iff(Array == 'New DCR will not work', 'New DCR will not work', strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]]"))
    | summarize make_set_if(p, p != 'New DCR will not work')
    };
Configure(toscalar(Check))
| extend set_p = iff(set_p == '[]', 'Blank', set_p)

parameters.name: NSADCR3
parameters.query:
let Count = print merged="{merged:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | summarize count()
    | extend Counter = toint(count_);
let Check =
    Count
    | extend Check = iff(Counter <= 200, 'DCR not needed', 'DCR needed')
    | extend Math = Counter - 100
    | extend diff = iff(Math < 0 or Math > 200, 'New DCR will not work', array_split(todynamic("{merged:escapejson}"), 200)[1])
    | extend diff = todynamic(diff)
    | mv-expand diff
    | project toint(diff)
    | top 100 by diff asc
    | summarize Array = make_set(diff);
let Configure = (Array:dynamic) { print Array
    | extend Array = todynamic(Array)
    | mv-expand Array
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",Array,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = iff(Array == 'New DCR will not work', 'New DCR will not work', strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]]"))
    | summarize make_set_if(p, p != 'New DCR will not work')
    };
Configure(toscalar(Check))
| extend set_p = iff(set_p == '[]', 'Blank', set_p)

print mitre_ids
| mv-expand print_0
| project Tactic = tostring(print_0.Tactic), Technique = tostring(print_0.Technique), Description = tostring(print_0.Description), EventIDs = tostring(print_0.EventIDs), Threat_Details = tostring(print_0.["Threat Details"])
| where Tactic has_any (set_items)
| extend EventIDs = split(EventIDs, ',')
| extend EventIDs = replace_regex(tostring(EventIDs), '\"', '')
| mv-expand todynamic(EventIDs)
| distinct toint(EventIDs)
| where isnotempty(EventIDs)
| order by EventIDs asc

parameters.name: parseManualMitre
parameters.query:
let manualIds = "{ManualEventsMitre}";
print ids=manualIds
| project ids = todynamic(strcat('[', replace_regex(ids,"\'",""),']'))
| mv-expand ids
| project ids = toint(ids)

parameters.name: parseExcludeMitre
parameters.query:
let manualIds = "{MitreExclude}";
print ids=manualIds
| project ids = todynamic(strcat('[', replace_regex(ids,"\'",""),']'))
| mv-expand ids
| project ids = toint(ids)

parameters.name: mergedMitre
generatedJSONMitre
parameters.query:
// Referenced merged array
let generated = () {
    print merged="{mergedMitre:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | top 100 by toint(merged) asc
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",merged,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]]")
    | summarize makeset(p)
};
generated

parameters.name: MITREDCR2
parameters.query:
let Count = print merged="{mergedMitre:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | summarize count()
    | extend Counter = toint(count_);
let Check =
    Count
    | extend Check = iff(Counter <= 100, 'DCR not needed', 'DCR needed')
    | extend Math = Counter - 100
    | extend diff = iff(Math < 0 or Math > 100, 'New DCR will not work', array_split(todynamic("{mergedMitre:escapejson}"), 100)[1])
    | extend diff = todynamic(diff)
    | mv-expand diff
    | project toint(diff)
    | top 100 by diff asc
    | summarize Array = make_set(diff);
let Configure = (Array:dynamic) { print Array
    | extend Array = todynamic(Array)
    | mv-expand Array
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",Array,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = iff(Array == 'New DCR will not work', 'New DCR will not work', strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]]"))
    | summarize make_set_if(p, p != 'New DCR will not work')
    };
Configure(toscalar(Check))
| extend set_p = iff(set_p == '[]', 'Blank', set_p)

content.json:
### Help

This section will list the current configured events that will have xPath generated. The events listed are the events that will be configured within the DCR when it is deployed. They are determined based on the input selected above. </br>

DCR's have a limit of 100 objects within its configuration. If 100 is exceeded, additional DCR's will need to be created in order to compensate for the remaining event IDs. If 100 is exceeded, this section will highlight such and extra xPath will be generated for the remaining event IDs. If 2 DCR's are not enough, a third will be made. Each new DCR will have a button at the bottom of the screen when ready.

### Manually Entered IDs: 
EventIDs: {parseManual} </br>

### Excluded IDs:
EventIDs: {parseExclude} </br>

### Full List of Manual and NSA IDs: 
EventIDs: {merged}</br>

### Manually Entered IDs: EventIDs: {parseManualMitre}
### Excluded IDs: EventIDs: {parseExcludeMitre}
### Full List of Manual and MITRE IDs: EventIDs: {mergedMitre}

### Manually Entered IDs: EventIDs: {parseManualMsft}
### Excluded IDs: EventIDs: {parseExcludeMsft}
### Full List of Manual and Recommended IDs: EventIDs: {mergedMsft}

content.query:
let IDCount = '{merged}';
print IDCount
| mv-expand Test = todynamic(print_0)
| summarize count() by print_0
| extend count_ = case(count_ >= 100 and count_ <= 200, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider spltting the array into one DCR with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-100)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 200 and count_ <=300, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into two DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-200)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 300 and count_ <=400, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into three DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-300)), ' events.'),
                    tostring(count_))
| project-away print_0
content.title: Number of Distinct IDs Selected for NSA DCR

let IDCount = '{mergedMitre}';
print IDCount
| mv-expand Test = todynamic(print_0)
| summarize count() by print_0
| project-away print_0
| extend count_ =  case(count_ >= 100 and count_ <= 200, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider spltting the array into one DCR with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-100)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 200 and count_ <=300, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into two DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-200)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 300 and count_ <=400, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into three DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-300)), ' events.'),
                    tostring(count_))
content.title: Number of Distinct IDs Selected for MITRE DCR

content.query:
let IDCount = '{mergedMsft}';
print IDCount
| mv-expand Test = todynamic(print_0)
| summarize count() by print_0
| project-away print_0
| extend count_ = case(count_ >= 100 and count_ <= 200, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider splitting the array into one DCR with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-100)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 200 and count_ <=300, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into two DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-200)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 300 and count_ <=400, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into three DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-300)), ' events.'),
                    tostring(count_))

content.title: MITRE Event ID Mapping

content.json:
### Help

This section lists the events that are aligned with the recommended Windows event IDs as highlighted in Appendix L. Each log has a criticality level that can be configured within the drop down. The value here is that every event is listed in order to reflect what will be collected and what it aligns with. This is meant to just be used as a reference for learning and checking before deploying a DCR.

content.title: Recommended Event IDs

content.json:
### Help

The events listed below are part of an ongoing MSTIC project that highlights logs and events that are related. This is meant to highlight potentially valuable events to ingest outside of the events configured above.

For more information on MSTIC, please see https://www.microsoft.com/security/blog/microsoft-security-intelligence/

content.title: Potential Related Logs to Consider

content.json:
### Help

This section allows for the naming of the newly configured DCR. This will be the name that the DCR takes on once it is created. In the event that multiple DCRs are required to cover all of the selected event IDs above, a second or third name box and deploy button will appear as needed.

parameters.name: DeployWorkspace
parameters.label: Deploy to Workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| project id, name
| order by name asc

parameters.name: DWLocation
parameters.query:
resources
| where id has '{DeployWorkspace}'
| project location

parameters.name: DCE
parameters.query:
resources
| where type has 'Microsoft.Insights/dataCollectionEndpoints'
| where location == '{DWLocation}'
| project id, name
| order by tolower(name) asc

content.json:
### Useful Information

This step will create a new custom table that will ingest the data from the configured Event Hub. This table will require:
1. A name
2. Columns of the table
- If the columns are known, they can be entered. By default, the columns will be TimeGenerated, RawData, and Properties. The data will then need to be parsed at ingestion time.
3. Table retention

Below are values that can be used within the template. 

#### New Table Name: {TableName} </br>
#### Selected Workspace Retention: {WSRetention}
*When using Microsoft Sentinel, retention can be set to 90 days without extra cost. If the selected workspace has retention under 90 days, it can be increased to 90 days without extra cost.*

*Note*: totalRetentionInDays represents the *total* number of days the data will exist in the workspace. </br> archiveRetentionInDays will be difference value found by using totalRetentionInDays - retentionInDays

parameters.name: Template

armActionContext.title: Create Table Called {TableName}?
armActionContext.description:
This action will create a new custom table based on the template below. Please confirm the name and columns are all the desired values.

```json
{Template}
```
-------
### Populated Value
```
Table Name: {TableName}
```

parameters.label: Select Data Collection Endpoint

resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionendpoints"
| where location == '{WSLocation}'
| project id, name

parameters.name: RGLocation
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| where id == '{Workspace}'
| project location

content.json:
### Useful Information

This step will create a new data collection rule if one does not exist already. The following template will require:
1. A name
2. The location of the resource group/workspace
3. The resource path for the desired data collection endpoint
4. The columns that the DCR should expect for the table. This can be copied from the custom table step
5. The consumer group of the Event Hub. If this is unknown, this can be left as $Default
6. The resource path of the workspace that will ingest the data

If there is an existing DCR that should be used, set the toggle value to yes, select the DCR, and click modify to open the template to make the required changes.

Please enter the following values in the template to the right next to their corresponding key values: </br>

#### Name: {newDCRName} </br>
#### Location: {RGLocation}</br>
#### DCE ID: {SelectedDCE} </br>
#### Workspace: {Workspace} </br>
#### New Table Name: Custom-{TableName}_CL

parameters.name: ADCR
parameters.label: Event Hub DCR

armActionContext.title: Create New Data Collection Rule{newDCRName}

parameters.name: SelectedDCR
parameters.label: Select Data Collection Rule
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend DataCollectionEndpoint = properties.dataCollectionEndpointId
| where DataCollectionEndpoint == '{SelectedDCE}'
| project id, name = tolower(name)
| order by name asc

content.json: ### Currently Modifying: {SelectedDCR:name}

parameters.name: Properties
parameters.query: {"version":"ARMEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[],"method":"GET","path":"{SelectedDCR}?api-version=2022-06-01","urlParams":[],"batchDisabled":false,"transformers":null}

parameters.name: DCRG
parameters.query:
print '{SelectedDCR}'
| extend holder = split(tostring('{SelectedDCR}'), '/')
| project RG = strcat( '/', holder[1],'/', holder[2], '/', holder[3], '/', holder[4])

parameters.label: Template
parameters.query: print test = dynamic({Properties})

armActionContext.title: Update Data Collection Rule: {name}
armActionContext.description: ### You are about to commit changes to DCR {name}. Please confirm the changes you have made are valid and are the intended changes that you would like to push. This API will be redeploying the ARM template for this DCR. Connected machines will not be dropped.

content.json:
### Useful Information

This step will provide the DCR that was chosen for Event Hub ingestion and will assign permissions to it to allow for ingestion to occur. The button below will open the selected Event Hub and allow for a role to be assigned. The role required for the DCR is the *Azure Event Hubs Data Receiver* role. </br>

Note: In order to grant the permission, the user creating the assignment will need *Microsoft.Authorization/* permissions on the resource. </br>

If the DCR does not appear in the search, please confirm that a system managed identity has been enabled and given to it. This should have been done in the step above.

parameters.name: SelectedEH
parameters.label: Select Event Hub
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.eventhub/namespaces"
| project id, name

parameters.name: SelectedDCR2
parameters.label: Select DCR
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend DataCollectionEndpoint = properties.dataCollectionEndpointId
| where DataCollectionEndpoint == '{SelectedDCE}'
| project id, name = tolower(name)
| order by name asc

content.json:
### Help

The Essentials area is designed to configure a DCR for either UEBA, Analytic Rules, and Hunting based on event IDs used within those features. The goal is to deploy a DCR for either feature that will enable for the features to work properly. If looking to add more event IDs, either set an ingestion tier above or manually enter the event IDs in the space below.

parameters.name: IngestArray
uebaIds
parameters.query: print '{UEBAEssentials}'

parameters.name: parseManualUEBA
parameters.query:
let manualIds = "{ManualEventsUEBA}";
print ids=manualIds
| project ids = todynamic(strcat('[', replace_regex(ids,"\'",""),']'))
| mv-expand ids
| project ids = toint(ids)

parameters.name: parseExcludeUEBA
parameters.query:
let manualIds = "{ExcludeUEBA}";
print ids=manualIds
| project ids = todynamic(strcat('[', replace_regex(ids,"\'",""),']'))
| mv-expand ids
| project ids = toint(ids)

parameters.name: mergedUEBA
generatedJSONUEBA
parameters.query:
// Referenced merged array
let generated = () {
    print merged="{mergedUEBA:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | top 100 by toint(merged) asc
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",merged,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]]")
    | summarize makeset(p)
};
generated

parameters.name: UEBADCR2
parameters.query:
let Count = print merged="{mergedUEBA:escapejson}"
    | extend merged=todynamic(merged)
    | mvexpand merged
    | summarize count()
    | extend Counter = toint(count_);
let Check =
    Count
    | extend Check = iff(Counter <= 100, 'DCR not needed', 'DCR needed')
    | extend Math = Counter - 100
    | extend diff = iff(Math < 0 or Math > 100, 'New DCR will not work', array_split(todynamic("{mergedUEBA:escapejson}"), 100)[1])
    | extend diff = todynamic(diff)
    | mv-expand diff
    | project toint(diff)
    | top 100 by diff asc
    | summarize Array = make_set(diff);
let Configure = (Array:dynamic) { print Array
    | extend Array = todynamic(Array)
    | mv-expand Array
    | extend merged = tostring(strcat("(EventID=",Array,")"))
    | sort by tolong(merged) asc
    | extend index=row_rank(merged)
    | summarize merged=makeset(merged) by (index/10)
    | extend concat= strcat_array(merged," or ")
    | project p = iff(Array == 'New DCR will not work', 'New DCR will not work', strcat("Security!*[System[",concat,"]"))
    | summarize make_set_if(p, p != 'New DCR will not work')
    };
Configure(toscalar(Check))
| extend set_p = iff(set_p == '[]', 'Blank', set_p)

content.query:
let IDCount = '{mergedUEBA}';
print IDCount
| mv-expand Test = todynamic(print_0)
| summarize count() by print_0
| extend count_ = case(count_ >= 100 and count_ <= 200, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider spltting the array into one DCR with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-100)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 200 and count_ <=300, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into two DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-200)), ' events.'),
                    count_ >= 300 and count_ <=400, strcat('DCR count limit reached. Consider filtering the log criticality or spltting the array into three DCRs with 100 events and one with ', tostring((count_-300)), ' events.'),
                    tostring(count_))
| project-away print_0

content.json:
### Help
This tab is dedicated to listing existing DCRs with all of their details. It also allows for you to make changes to the DCR and deploy those changes without having to leave the workbook. </br>

The listed DCRs below contain: </br>
- The DCR name with a link to the resource
- The rule type (Windows, Linux, Custom, etc.)
- DCR location
- If Syslog is configured and a link to a summary of the configuration
- If Windows events are configured and a link to a summary of the configuration
- If Security events are configured and a link to a summary of the configuration
- If the DCR is pointing to a data collection endpoint (DCE) with a link to the resource
- If the DCR contains a KQL transformation rule with a link to a summary of the KQL
- The worksapce that the DCR is pointing to with a link to the resource.

This list should be used to review existing collection rules, evaluate if there are duplicate rules, and monitor existing rules to track ongoing ingestion.

content.json:
### Help

This view within the tab is meant to highlight which workspaces currently have one or more DCR's sending data to them. This data should be reviewed in order to monitor which workpaces are ingesting data and if there are duplicates within the data.

## Configure Data Collection Rule (DCR)
The most simplist way to explain a DCR is it manages the data flow from data sources to log analytics

Data Collection Rules (DCRs) define the data collection process in Azure Monitor. DCRs specify what data should be collected, how to transform that data, and where to send that data. Some DCRs will be created and managed by Azure Monitor to collect a specific set of data to enable insights and visualizations. You may also create your own DCRs to define the set of data required for other scenarios.

- [Data collection rules in Azure Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-rule-overview)

Decide if you want to create a new rule from scratch or copy an existing rule and change some parameters.
No DCR rule selected to copy!

content.query:
print rule=todynamic("{selectedRule:escapejson}")
| evaluate bag_unpack(rule)
| extend dataFlows = todynamic(dataFlows)
| extend kqlQueries = array_length(dataFlows)
| extend destinations = todynamic(destinations)
// Filter dataflows if a specific dataflow is selected
| mv-apply dataFlows on
(
    where dataFlows.streams contains "{selectedStream}" or isempty("{selectedStream}")
    | summarize dataFlows=make_set(dataFlows)
)
//| where dataFlows.streams contains "{selectedStream}" or isempty("{selectedStream}")

content.query:
// Get data collection rules
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend type = iff(kind=="","Custom",kind)
| project id, type, location, resourceGroup, properties
| extend dataFlows = array_length(properties.dataFlows), destinations = array_length(properties.destinations.logAnalytics)
| mv-expand destinations = properties.destinations.logAnalytics
| extend workspaceResourceId = tolower(tostring(destinations.workspaceResourceId))
| extend dataFlows = properties.dataFlows, WorkspaceName = split(workspaceResourceId, '/')[8]
| mvexpand dataFlows
| mvexpand dataFlows.destinations, dataFlows.streams

content.json:
### Help

This section is meant to highlight the DCRs that currently exist, where they are reporting data to, and which events they are collecting. The goal is to higlight that there may be DCRs that are duplicated data based on their configuration. 

To review, click on each group title to expand the content. Each group will contain a list of workspaces that can be expanded. These drop-downs will show a list of event IDs that are configured in DCRs and which DCRs contain the event ID.

Please keep in mind that there may be logs for security events, syslog, CEF, or custom logs that are being ingested via MMA and not AMA, as well as the legacy ingestion API instead of the new Azure Monitor ingestion API.

#### _Note_: Data Collection Rule templates do not contain which machines are provisioned by that DCR. This is not available today. Until that data is available, it will not possible to highlight which machines are sending logs twice via 2 or more DCRs.

content.query:
print DCRs = dynamic({dcrlist})
| evaluate bag_unpack(DCRs)
| mv-expand value
| evaluate bag_unpack(value)
| where kind has 'windows'
| project DCR = split(id, '/').[8], test = properties.dataSources.windowsEventLogs[0].xPathQueries, Workspace = tostring(split(tostring(properties.destinations.logAnalytics.[0].workspaceResourceId), '/')[8])
| where test has 'EventID=' and test !has'level='
| extend test = replace_string(tostring(test), ')', ',')
| extend test2 = replace_regex(tostring(test), '[^0-9,]+', '')
| extend test2 = trim_end(',', test2)
| extend test2 = strcat('[', test2, ']')
| mv-expand test3 = split(test2, ',')
| extend test3 = replace_string(tostring(test3), '[', '')
| extend EventID = replace_string(tostring(test3), ']', '')
| summarize DCRs = make_list(DCR) by tostring(Workspace), tostring(EventID)
content.title: Events Collected via DCRs to Workspaces

| summarize GBytes = sum(_BilledSize)/(1024*1024*1024) by EventID, Computer
| order by GBytes desc

content.query:
union withsource =SourceTable *_CL
| where _IsBillable = true
| summarize GBytes = sum(_BilledSize)/(1024*1024*1024) by endofday(TimeGenerated), bin(endofday(TimeGenerated), 1d)
content.title: Ingestion per GB per Custom Table
